page.title: 09DAISYNOOK COUNTRY PARK
page.content: The whole length of the Medlock valley is now a country park, looked after by the Medlock Valley conservation group and the G.M.C. The area is a lung of green for the surrounding urban areas like Oldham, Ashton and Manchester. The Park has removed many eyesores of the 19th century development of the area. The Park is popular for many activities - walking, jogging, horse riding, birdwatching, fishing and nature/wildlife trails. Information centres, car parks, picnic areas and toilets are provided. The Crime View public house overlooks the Park and other refreshments are available nearby. The Daisynook Fair is held every year at Easter and proves to be a big attraction.
